elementDefinition.name: Conformance
elementDefinition.definition: A conformance statement returned by request in an RESTful framework

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.id
elementDefinition.definition: Globally unique Conformance Statement Id (Must be a UUID)

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.date
elementDefinition.definition: Date that the conformance statement is published

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.publisher
elementDefinition.definition: The organization that publishes this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.publisher.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name of Organization

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.publisher.address
elementDefinition.definition: Address of Organization

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.publisher.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contacts for Organization

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.software
elementDefinition.definition: The software that is covered by this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.software.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name software is known by

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.software.version
elementDefinition.definition: Version covered by this statement

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.software.releaseDate
elementDefinition.definition: Date this version released

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.mode
elementDefinition.definition: client | server

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.profile
elementDefinition.definition: Additional other profiles that apply to this conformance statement.
elementDefinition.comments: Generally these profiles make constraints on the bindings of concept domains / value sets

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.resource
elementDefinition.definition: Resource Type with constraints

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation
elementDefinition.condition: A resource type is required if the event declaration has multiple focal resources

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.read
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.vread
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.update
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.delete
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.validate
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.history
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.transaction
elementDefinition.definition: only if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.transaction.name
elementDefinition.definition: transaction names supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.search
elementDefinition.definition: only if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.search.param
elementDefinition.definition: search params supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.create
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.create.id
elementDefinition.definition: source of id: client | server | either

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.updates
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.updates.param
elementDefinition.definition: update filter params supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.operation.schema
elementDefinition.definition: if supported

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Conformance.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of conformance profile for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: Document
elementDefinition.definition: A documentation of clinical observations and services that are aggregated together into a single statement of clinical meaning that establishes it's own context. A clinical document is composed of a set of resources that include both human and computer readable portions. A human must attest to the accuracy of the human readable portion, and may authenticate and/or sign the entire whole
elementDefinition.requirements: For document based framework

elementDefinition.name: Document.id
elementDefinition.definition: the unique id of a clinical document
elementDefinition.requirements: Each document needs a unique identifier so other documents and underlying infrastructure can reference it
elementDefinition.comments: must be globally unique. UUIDs are recommended

elementDefinition.name: Document.instant
elementDefinition.definition: the document creation time, when the document first came into being. Where the CDA document is a transform from an original document in some other format, the ClinicalDocument.effectiveTime is the time the original document is created.

elementDefinition.name: Document.type
elementDefinition.definition: specifying the particular kind of document (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note)

elementDefinition.name: Document.title
elementDefinition.definition: the title of the document
elementDefinition.comments: It's commonly the case that clinical documents do not have a title, and are collectively referred to by the display name of Document.type (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note"). Where these display names are rendered to the clinician, or where the document has a unique title, the Document.title value should be used

elementDefinition.name: Document.setId
elementDefinition.condition: cannot have both setId and replaces
elementDefinition.definition: Represents an identifier that is common across all document revisions

elementDefinition.name: Document.version
elementDefinition.definition: used to version successive replacement documents
elementDefinition.comments: An integer value is recommended

elementDefinition.name: Document.replaces
elementDefinition.condition: cannot have both setId and replaces
elementDefinition.definition: If this document replaces another

elementDefinition.name: Document.subject
elementDefinition.definition: who the document is about

elementDefinition.name: Document.author
elementDefinition.definition: Author (contributed content to document)

elementDefinition.name: Document.author.time
elementDefinition.definition: When authoring happened

elementDefinition.name: Document.author.party
elementDefinition.definition: who/what authored the final document

elementDefinition.name: Document.attestor
elementDefinition.definition: a participant who has attested to the accuracy of the document

elementDefinition.name: Document.attestor.mode
elementDefinition.definition: The type of attestation the authenticator offers

elementDefinition.name: Document.attestor.time
elementDefinition.definition: When document attested

elementDefinition.name: Document.attestor.party
elementDefinition.definition: who attested the document

elementDefinition.name: Document.recipient
elementDefinition.definition: expected to receive a copy

elementDefinition.name: Document.custodian
elementDefinition.definition: org which maintains the document.

elementDefinition.name: Document.event
elementDefinition.definition: the main Act, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented
elementDefinition.comments: The event needs to be consistent with the type element, though can provide further information if desired

elementDefinition.name: Document.encounter
elementDefinition.definition: context of the document

elementDefinition.name: Document.section
elementDefinition.definition: Document is broken into sections

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.type
elementDefinition.definition: type of section (recommended)

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.instant
elementDefinition.definition: the section creation time (sections are often re-used in several documents).

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.author
elementDefinition.definition: if section author different to document

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.author.time
elementDefinition.definition: When authoring happened

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.author.party
elementDefinition.definition: who/what authored the section

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.enterer
elementDefinition.definition: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this section. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.subject
elementDefinition.definition: if section different to document

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.informant
elementDefinition.definition: provided information in section

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.content
elementDefinition.condition: a section must have content or one or more sections
elementDefinition.definition: the actual content of the section

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.section
elementDefinition.condition: a section must have content or one or more sections
elementDefinition.definition: nested Section

elementDefinition.name: Document.section.section.#
elementDefinition.definition: contents as for a section

elementDefinition.name: Document.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Message
elementDefinition.definition: A message that contains FHIR resources
elementDefinition.requirements: Many implementations are not prepared to use REST, and need a message based infrastructure

elementDefinition.name: Message.id
elementDefinition.definition: Unique Id for this message
elementDefinition.requirements: Each message needs a unique identifier so other messages and underlying infrastructure can reference it
elementDefinition.comments: must be unique within a channel, but should be globally unique. UUIDs are recommended

elementDefinition.name: Message.threadId
elementDefinition.definition: Id of the thread - a series of messages that pertain to the same logical sequence, and are all identified by the same thread identifier

elementDefinition.name: Message.instant
elementDefinition.definition: Instant the message was sent

elementDefinition.name: Message.event
elementDefinition.definition: Code that identifies the event this message represents, and connects it with the event definition in the FHIR specification

elementDefinition.name: Message.response
elementDefinition.definition: Information about the the message that this message is a response to - if it is a response

elementDefinition.name: Message.response.id
elementDefinition.definition: The id of the message that this a response to
elementDefinition.comments: this message must have the same threadId as the original message (including missing if the original message threadId was missing)

elementDefinition.name: Message.response.code
elementDefinition.definition: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not
elementDefinition.comments: This is a generic response to the request message. Specific data for the response will be found in Message.data

elementDefinition.name: Message.response.duplicate
elementDefinition.definition: True if this is not the first response, because the request message has been received more than once
elementDefinition.comments: The request shouldn't be received more than once if reliable message delivery applies, but mostly it doesn't

elementDefinition.name: Message.source
elementDefinition.definition: The source application from which this message originated

elementDefinition.name: Message.destination
elementDefinition.definition: The destination application which the message is intended for

elementDefinition.name: Message.enterer
elementDefinition.definition: The person or device that performd the data entry leading to this message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements
elementDefinition.comments: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response

elementDefinition.name: Message.author
elementDefinition.definition: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided it should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements
elementDefinition.comments: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response

elementDefinition.name: Message.responsible
elementDefinition.definition: The person or organization that accepts overall responsbility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements
elementDefinition.comments: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response

elementDefinition.name: Message.effective
elementDefinition.definition: The effective time - the real world time of the even that the message represents. Usually this is just a starting time, but some message events also have an end time (do x for period y)
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know for understanding the content of the message
elementDefinition.comments: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response
elementDefinition.todo: Grahame thinks this is not 80/20. Also, that it reall should be domain modeled, not tucked away here

elementDefinition.name: Message.reason
elementDefinition.definition: The cause of the event - a reason for why this message is being sent
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track why resources are being changed and report in the audit log / history of the resource

elementDefinition.name: Message.data
elementDefinition.condition: Mandatory unless the message is a response, in which case the element is optional
elementDefinition.definition: The actual data of the message - a reference to the focus class of the message.
elementDefinition.requirements: Every message event is about actual data, a single resource, that is identified in the definition of the event, and perhaps some or all linked resources
elementDefinition.comments: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always aggregated with the transaction resource

elementDefinition.name: Message.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Animal
elementDefinition.definition: An animal that has relevance to the care process -usually this is for animals that are patients.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track animals - vetinary medicine is an active user of HL7 standards
elementDefinition.comments: Animals differ because you need to track species and strain, and also different kind of relationships - owners

elementDefinition.name: Animal.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Animal.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier for the animal that is used to identify the person across multiple disparate systems and also for face to face identification of the person
elementDefinition.requirements: Animals are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the animal

elementDefinition.name: Animal.name
elementDefinition.definition: A name associated with the animal. The use code maiden does not apply.
elementDefinition.requirements: Some animals have names, which are assigned by humans for human reasons, and follow human naming patterns

elementDefinition.name: Animal.dob
elementDefinition.definition: The birth date for the animal
elementDefinition.requirements: Age of the animal drives many clinical processes.
elementDefinition.todo: RIM change to support human date (time only - but is this needed in this context?)

elementDefinition.name: Animal.species
elementDefinition.definition: Species for the animal
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know what kind of animal

elementDefinition.name: Animal.strain
elementDefinition.definition: Strain for the animal
elementDefinition.requirements: May need to know the specific kind within the species
elementDefinition.todo: Not sure why this is ED in the RIM. Should probably change to SC.

elementDefinition.name: Animal.gender
elementDefinition.definition: Gender for the Animal
elementDefinition.requirements: For managing the animal
elementDefinition.comments: Note that some animals have additional gender not encountered in humans?

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity
elementDefinition.definition: Kin, owner, care giver etc

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity.id
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier for the entity

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity.role
elementDefinition.definition: Type of relationship

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name of the related entity

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity.address
elementDefinition.definition: An address (usually human, but may be kin)

elementDefinition.name: Animal.relatedEntity.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contact details (usually for humans)

elementDefinition.name: Animal.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Agent
elementDefinition.definition: A person who represents an organisation, and is authorised to perform actions on it's behalf
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to track doctors, staff, locums etc for both healthcare providers, funders, etc.

elementDefinition.name: Agent.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Agent.person
elementDefinition.definition: The person who acts as the agent
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track the person who represents the organisation separately

elementDefinition.name: Agent.organization
elementDefinition.definition: The organisation that is being represented
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track the represented organisation separately

elementDefinition.name: Agent.role
elementDefinition.definition: The way in which the person represents the organisation - what role do they have?
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know what authority the agent has - what can they do?
elementDefinition.comments: A person may have more than one role. At least one role is required - why have an agent who isn't actually an agent?

elementDefinition.name: Agent.period
elementDefinition.definition: The time period during which the agent was/is authorised to represent the organisation.
elementDefinition.requirements: Agencies are often for a limited period of time, and can be revoked. Even after the agencies is revoked, the fact that it existed must still be recorded

elementDefinition.name: Agent.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: An identifier that applies to this person in this role
elementDefinition.requirements: Often, specific identifies are assigned for the agent
elementDefinition.comments: The identifier changes when a new/different person steps into the same role

elementDefinition.name: Agent.address
elementDefinition.definition: A postal address for this person playing this role
elementDefinition.comments: i.e. the address is not their personal address. For many agents, this is the same as their work address

elementDefinition.name: Agent.contact
elementDefinition.definition: A contact detail address for this person playing this role
elementDefinition.comments: i.e. the contact is not their personal contact. For many agents, this is the same as their work contacts. Note that a person may choose to use a personal mobile phone (for instance) for their contact in a given role - in this case, the contact detail will be repeated in the agent resource

elementDefinition.name: Agent.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Agent.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of the agent, for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance
elementDefinition.definition: A conformance statement about how an application uses FHIR messaging

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.id
elementDefinition.definition: Globally unique Conformance Statement Id (Must be a UUID)

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.date
elementDefinition.definition: Date that the conformance statement is published

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.publisher
elementDefinition.definition: The organization that publishes this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.publisher.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name of Organization

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.publisher.address
elementDefinition.definition: Address of Organization

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.publisher.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contacts for Organization

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.software
elementDefinition.definition: The software that is covered by this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.software.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name software is known by

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.software.version
elementDefinition.definition: Version covered by this statement

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.software.releaseDate
elementDefinition.definition: Date this version released

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.profile
elementDefinition.definition: Additional other profiles that apply to this conformance statement.
elementDefinition.comments: Generally these profiles make constraints on the bindings of concept domains / value sets

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event
elementDefinition.definition: An event supported by the application

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.code
elementDefinition.definition: The code for the event

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.resource
elementDefinition.condition: A resource type is required if the event declaration has multiple focal resources
elementDefinition.definition: The focal resource for the event

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.mode
elementDefinition.definition: The mode of this event declaration - whether application is sender or receiver

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.request
elementDefinition.definition: Information about the request for this event

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.request.resource
elementDefinition.definition: Constraint on a resource used in the event request

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.response
elementDefinition.definition: Information about the response for this event

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.event.response.resource
elementDefinition.definition: Constraint on a resource used in the event response

elementDefinition.name: MessageConformance.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Organization
elementDefinition.definition: For any organization/institution/government department that has relevance to the care process

elementDefinition.name: Organization.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Organization.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier for the organization that is used to identify the organization across multiple disparate systems
elementDefinition.requirements: Organizations are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the organization.

elementDefinition.name: Organization.name
elementDefinition.definition: A name associated with the organization
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to use the name as the label of the organization
elementDefinition.comments: Don't use HumanName since that has many non-organization things in it

elementDefinition.name: Organization.name.value
elementDefinition.definition: The actual name of the organization

elementDefinition.name: Organization.name.period
elementDefinition.definition: The period that this name was in use by the organization
elementDefinition.requirements: Organizations have a habit of renaming themselves, and the current and past names are required

elementDefinition.name: Organization.address
elementDefinition.definition: An address for the organization
elementDefinition.requirements: May need to keep track of the organizations addresses for contacting, billing or reporting requirements
elementDefinition.comments: Organization may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods. The use code home is not to be used

elementDefinition.name: Organization.contact
elementDefinition.definition: A contact detail for the organization
elementDefinition.requirements: Human contact for the organization
elementDefinition.comments: The use code home is not to be used. Note that these contacts are not the contact details of people who are employed by or represent the organization, but official contacts for the organization itself

elementDefinition.name: Organization.code
elementDefinition.definition: The kind of organization that this is
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track the kind of organization that this is - different organization types have different uses
elementDefinition.comments: Organizations can be corporations, wards, sections, clinical teams, government departments, etc. Note that code is generally a classifier of the type of organization; in many applications, codes are used to identity a particular organization (say, ward) as opposed to another of the same type - these are identifiers, not codes
elementDefinition.todo: Name code is too RIM-like. Should be typeCode or type.

elementDefinition.name: Organization.industryCode
elementDefinition.definition: The industry that this organization is involved in
elementDefinition.requirements: For some organization types, an industry code is required for statistical reporting requirements

elementDefinition.name: Organization.accreditation
elementDefinition.definition: The qualifications a person has, including format educational achievements, accreditations, and current certifications. All these qualifications may be used to determine what roles a person may play in a healthcare environment
elementDefinition.requirements: For many persons in healthcare, it is necessary to track the qualifications a person has - formal.
elementDefinition.todo: Not sure if qualified & accredited are the same. Could potentially propose a new classCode

elementDefinition.name: Organization.accreditation.id
elementDefinition.definition: The identifier of the accreditation
elementDefinition.requirements: Allows a link back to a accreditation registry, if one exists

elementDefinition.name: Organization.accreditation.code
elementDefinition.definition: The type of the accreditation
elementDefinition.requirements: commonly used to determine the roles an organization may perform

elementDefinition.name: Organization.accreditation.institution
elementDefinition.definition: The organization that confered/confers the accreditation
elementDefinition.requirements: May determine the significance of the qualification, and allows a link back to a qualification registry, if one exists
elementDefinition.todo: Do we need jurisdiction as well? (The jurisdiction is often more relevant than the accrediting org.)

elementDefinition.name: Organization.accreditation.period
elementDefinition.definition: The period for which the accreditation is held
elementDefinition.requirements: Most accreditations are only conferred for a limited time period and must be re-acquired or forfeited

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization
elementDefinition.definition: Other organizations who are related to this person. The relationship might be one of several types: sub- or super- orgnizations (i.e. ward in a hospital, owning corporation of a hospital) or partner organizations (i.e. the operating corporation for a hospital)
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track many kinds of organizational relationships and use to determine roles and mediate workflows
elementDefinition.todo: There's no reason why this wouldn't point to another resource. Will map when updated accordingly.

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.id
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier the related organization - may be a full link to an Organization resource, or some other kind of identifier
elementDefinition.requirements: may have an identifier for the organization that can be used to source contact details

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.code
elementDefinition.definition: Code that specifies how this organization is related to the subject. A code is required.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know how the organization is related

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.name
elementDefinition.definition: A name should be specified for the related organization

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.address
elementDefinition.definition: Postal addresses may be provided for the related organization

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contact details (phone, email etc) may be provided for the related organization

elementDefinition.name: Organization.relatedOrganization.period
elementDefinition.definition: The period during which the organizations were related in this fashion
elementDefinition.requirements: Organization relationships are changing all the time

elementDefinition.name: Organization.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Organization.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of organization, fall back for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: Prescription
elementDefinition.definition: Directions provided by a prescribing practitioner for a specific medication to be administered to an individual
elementDefinition.requirements: Used to record details about the prescribed medication, administration schedule, dosage and dispensing.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: A identifier used in an external system and associated with this medication
elementDefinition.requirements: Prescriptions are almost always assigned specific numerical identifiers

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.status
elementDefinition.definition: Actual status of the prescription

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.patient
elementDefinition.definition: The patient the prescription is prescribing medicine for

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.prescriber
elementDefinition.definition: The clinician or doctor prescribing the medication

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.prescribed
elementDefinition.definition: Date/time on which the prescription was written

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.dispense
elementDefinition.definition: Details of the dispense as requested by the prescriber

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.dispense.repeats
elementDefinition.definition: Requested number of repeats
elementDefinition.comments: Default is "1"

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.dispense.quantity
elementDefinition.definition: Requested quantity per repeat

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.dispense.dispenser
elementDefinition.definition: Person to fullfil the requested dispense

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine
elementDefinition.definition: The one single medicatine, vaccine or therapeutic good prescribed in this prescription.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.productCode
elementDefinition.condition: Can only be left empty if it cannot be coded
elementDefinition.definition: Coded representation of medicine

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.description
elementDefinition.condition: Mandatory when medication cannot be coded
elementDefinition.definition: Textual description of medicine, including strength and ingredients

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.activeIngredient
elementDefinition.definition: The substance in the medication formulation that is pharmaceutically active and is responsible for the medication's therapeutic effect

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.activeIngredient.productCode
elementDefinition.definition: Coded representation of active ingredient

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.activeIngredient.quantity
elementDefinition.definition: Quantity of active ingredient expressed in relation to the whole of the prepared medicine

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.inactiveIngredient
elementDefinition.definition: Ingredients in the medication that are not active

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.inactiveIngredient.productCode
elementDefinition.definition: Coded representation of the inactive ingredient

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.medicine.inactiveIngredient.quantity
elementDefinition.definition: Quantity of inactive ingredient expressed in relation to the whole of the prepared medicine

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest
elementDefinition.definition: Instructions for the use of the medication. Includes details about the timing schedule, dosis amounts and additional usage instructions.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.description
elementDefinition.definition: Textual description of the use of the medication.
elementDefinition.comments: Can contain more details than the structured information under this element, but must be in accordance with it. May not contain information about the medicine itself.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.totalPeriodicDosis
elementDefinition.definition: Total dose per day/week or other period when more specific information is missing or cannot be expressed using the timing specifications.
elementDefinition.requirements: It should be possible, as a last resort, to specify e.g. a daily dosis, even if more specific details are unknown

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.start
elementDefinition.condition: Duration is given OR (Start is given AND (Duration OR End is given)) OR (Duration, Start and End are not given)
elementDefinition.definition: First moment on which medication should be taken

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.end
elementDefinition.condition: Duration is given OR (Start is given AND (Duration OR End is given)) OR (Duration, Start and End are not given)
elementDefinition.definition: Last moment on which medication should be taken

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.duration
elementDefinition.condition: Duration is given OR (Start is given AND (Duration OR End is given)) OR (Duration, Start and End are not given)
elementDefinition.definition: Total duration of administration

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.numberOfAdministrations
elementDefinition.condition: Can be given instead of Duration, as specified above
elementDefinition.definition: Maximum number of separate administrations before the instruction ends.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction
elementDefinition.definition: Specification of dose and schedule for administration
elementDefinition.comments: The can be >1 dosage instruction to support administration of varying doses, resulting in 1 instruction per fixed dose.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.precondition
elementDefinition.definition: Precondition for starting the administration specified in this instruction

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.prn
elementDefinition.definition: Pro re nate, "If necessary": Specifies whether administration depens on the state and symptoms of the patient
elementDefinition.comments: Default is "false"

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.additionalInstruction
elementDefinition.definition: Additional details to guide administration. Especially relevant for medicine administered by patient

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.route
elementDefinition.definition: Route of administration (oral, nasal, intravenous)
elementDefinition.comments: Since the route of administration is generally determined by the choice of medication, it is not necessary to provide a value in route

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose[x]
elementDefinition.definition: Dose per administration, expressed in units of the (prepared) product
elementDefinition.comments: Dose may be an interval, "2-3 tablets per 4 hours"

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.rate
elementDefinition.definition: Flow-rate for IV

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.administrationRequest.dosageInstruction.schedule
elementDefinition.definition: Schedule for administration. If multiple are given, they are considered to be active in parrallel
elementDefinition.comments: Will submit proposal to change Schedule type.

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.reason
elementDefinition.definition: Diagnosis which is the reason for prescribing this medicine

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Prescription.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of the prescription, for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: Profile
elementDefinition.definition: A Resource Profile - a statement of constraint on one or more Resources and/or Concept Domains
elementDefinition.comments: Often called a clinical template

elementDefinition.name: Profile.id
elementDefinition.definition: Globally unique Profile Id (Must be a UUID)

elementDefinition.name: Profile.name
elementDefinition.definition: A free text natural language name identifying the Template.
elementDefinition.comments: Not expected to be unique

elementDefinition.name: Profile.author
elementDefinition.definition: Details of the author who accepts responsibility for publishing the profile
elementDefinition.comments: Usually an organisation, but may be an individual

elementDefinition.name: Profile.author.name
elementDefinition.definition: The name of the author

elementDefinition.name: Profile.author.reference
elementDefinition.definition: Reference to the author to assist a user in finding and communicating with the author
elementDefinition.comments: may be a web site, an email address, a telephone number

elementDefinition.name: Profile.intention
elementDefinition.definition: A free text natural language description of the intent and scope of the Template. The purpose is to provide the author’s initial intent for the Template in the language specified below.

elementDefinition.name: Profile.code
elementDefinition.definition: A set of terms from a controlled reference terminology that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates

elementDefinition.name: Profile.description
elementDefinition.definition: A free text natural language description of the Template. Generally, this field should be used for things such as goals, variable lists, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature, examples from paper world, mapping from natural language to HL7 and the model itself, etc

elementDefinition.name: Profile.evidence
elementDefinition.definition: A description, reference or link to a published medical knowledge that was used in the definition of this Template

elementDefinition.name: Profile.comments
elementDefinition.definition: A statement regarding when this Template should not be used, or may be used erroneously. To define roles where the Template should not be used, or should be used with care. This field is used to expand in detail on the iIntention

elementDefinition.name: Profile.status
elementDefinition.definition: draft | testing | production | withdrawn | superceded

elementDefinition.name: Profile.date
elementDefinition.definition: The date that the current value for publicationStatus was applied to the Template

elementDefinition.name: Profile.endorser
elementDefinition.definition: A list of bodies who have reviewed the Template for clinical accuracy and relevance, and endorsed it for use.

elementDefinition.name: Profile.endorser.name
elementDefinition.definition: The name of the endorsing body

elementDefinition.name: Profile.endorser.reference
elementDefinition.definition: Reference to the author to assist a user in finding and communicating with the endorsing body

elementDefinition.name: Profile.changes
elementDefinition.condition: This field must be populated if the template is not the first version.
elementDefinition.definition: A free text description describing the changes in this version of the profile as compared to the previous version.

elementDefinition.name: Profile.supercedes
elementDefinition.definition: A template that is supercded by this template (maybe a previous version)

elementDefinition.name: Profile.profile
elementDefinition.definition: Additional other profiles that apply to this conformance statement.
elementDefinition.comments: Generally these profiles make constraints on the bindings of concept domains / value sets

elementDefinition.name: Profile.resource
elementDefinition.definition: Resource Type with constraints

elementDefinition.name: Profile.binding.name
elementDefinition.definition: The name of the concept domain that this profile is declaring a constraint on

elementDefinition.name: Profile.binding.type
elementDefinition.definition: The form of the binding

elementDefinition.name: Profile.binding.details
elementDefinition.condition: May be required depending on the value of binding.type
elementDefinition.definition: extra details - see notes

elementDefinition.name: Profile.binding.reference
elementDefinition.condition: May be required depending on the value of binding.type
elementDefinition.definition: source of binding content

elementDefinition.name: Profile.binding.code
elementDefinition.condition: May be required depending on the value of binding.type
elementDefinition.definition: enumerated codes that are the binding

elementDefinition.name: Profile.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Profile.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of resource profile for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: Patient
elementDefinition.definition: A patient is a person or animal that is receiving care
elementDefinition.requirements: Tracking patient is the center of the healthcare process

elementDefinition.name: Patient.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Patient.link
elementDefinition.definition: A linked patient record is a record that concerns the same patient. Records are linked after it is realised that at least one was created in error.
elementDefinition.requirements: Due to the clerical errors associated with the difficulties of identifying humans consistently, duplicate patient records are frequently created in error
elementDefinition.comments: More then two patient records may be linked. Note that there is a special transaction for linking patient records in the RESTful context, as record linking consistency must be maintained

elementDefinition.name: Patient.active
elementDefinition.definition: Whether the patient record is in use, or has been removed from active use
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to mark a patient record as not to be used because it was created in error
elementDefinition.comments: If a record is inactive, and linked to an active record, then future patient/person/record updates should occur on the other patient

elementDefinition.name: Patient.person
elementDefinition.condition: Either an animal or a person must be provided, but not both
elementDefinition.definition: The person that this patient record is about
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to link this patient record to a known and identifiable person (or animal)

elementDefinition.name: Patient.animal
elementDefinition.condition: Either an animal or a person must be provided, but not both
elementDefinition.definition: The animal that this patient record is about
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to link this patient record to a known and identifiable animal (or person)

elementDefinition.name: Patient.provider
elementDefinition.definition: The provider for whom this is a patient record
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know who recognises this patient record
elementDefinition.todo: But is thie same as institution above?

elementDefinition.name: Patient.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: An identifier that applies to this person as a patient
elementDefinition.requirements: Patients are almos always assigned specific numerical identifiers

elementDefinition.name: Patient.diet
elementDefinition.definition: Dietary restrictions for the patient
elementDefinition.requirements: Track patients reported dietary restrictions to help with catering requirements
elementDefinition.comments: not for specifying medical diets, but for casual dietary restrictions such as vegetarian, diary-free, nut-free, etc

elementDefinition.name: Patient.confidentiality
elementDefinition.definition: Confidentiality of the patient records
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track which patient records are particularly sensitive
elementDefinition.comments: Confidentiality tracking also occurs at more detailed points in the medical record

elementDefinition.name: Patient.recordLocation
elementDefinition.definition: The location of the paper record for the patient, if there is one
elementDefinition.requirements: Track old paper records where these are still in use

elementDefinition.name: Patient.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Patient.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of person, for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: Person
elementDefinition.definition: A person who is involved in the healthcare process
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to track persons across multiple roles

elementDefinition.name: Person.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources

elementDefinition.name: Person.identifier
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier for the person that is used to identify the person across multiple disparate systems and also for face to face identification of the person
elementDefinition.requirements: People are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the patient.

elementDefinition.name: Person.name
elementDefinition.definition: A name associated with the person
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track the person by multiple names
elementDefinition.comments: Person may have multiple names with different uses or applicable periods

elementDefinition.name: Person.address
elementDefinition.definition: An address for the person
elementDefinition.requirements: May need to keep track of persons addresses for contacting, billing or reporting requirements and also to help with identification
elementDefinition.comments: Person may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods

elementDefinition.name: Person.contact
elementDefinition.definition: A contact detail for the person
elementDefinition.requirements: May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification
elementDefinition.comments: Person may have multiple contacts with different uses or applicable periods

elementDefinition.name: Person.dob
elementDefinition.definition: The birth date for the person
elementDefinition.requirements: Age of person drives many clinical processes.
elementDefinition.comments: At least a estimated year should be provided as a guess if the real dob is unknown

elementDefinition.name: Person.gender
elementDefinition.definition: Administrative Gender
elementDefinition.requirements: Patient Identification, and also for managing the patient

elementDefinition.name: Person.religion
elementDefinition.definition: The religious denomination to which a person professes affiliation
elementDefinition.requirements: The religion of a person may influence ancilliary processes around the provision of healthcare, and may provide general advice with regard to diet, etc
elementDefinition.comments: Not all people have a formal religious affiliation

elementDefinition.name: Person.race
elementDefinition.definition: blah balh
elementDefinition.requirements: This is added because many jurisdictions insisted on it
elementDefinition.comments: Some places do not use this!

elementDefinition.name: Person.qualification
elementDefinition.definition: The qualifications a person has, including formal educational achievements, accreditations, and current certifications. All these qualifications may be used to determine what roles a person may play in a healthcare environment
elementDefinition.requirements: For many persons in healthcare, it is necessary to track the qualifications a person has - formal.

elementDefinition.name: Person.qualification.id
elementDefinition.definition: The identifier of a qualification
elementDefinition.requirements: Allows a link back to a qualification registry, if one exists

elementDefinition.name: Person.qualification.code
elementDefinition.definition: The type of the qualification
elementDefinition.requirements: commonly used to determine the roles a person may play

elementDefinition.name: Person.qualification.institution
elementDefinition.definition: The organisation that confered/confers the qualification
elementDefinition.requirements: May determine the significance of the qualification, and allows a link back to a qualification registry, if one exists

elementDefinition.name: Person.qualification.period
elementDefinition.definition: The period for which a qualification is held
elementDefinition.requirements: Some qualifications are only conferred for a limited time period and must be re-acquired or forfeited
elementDefinition.comments: Formal degrees may have a known start date, but no end date

elementDefinition.name: Person.language
elementDefinition.definition: A language spoken by the person, with proficiency
elementDefinition.requirements: If a patient does not speak the local language, interpreters may be required, so languages spoken and profiency is an important things to keep track of both for patient and other persons of interest
elementDefinition.comments: If no language is specified, this *implies* that the default local language is spoken

elementDefinition.name: Person.language.code
elementDefinition.definition: A code that identifies the language
elementDefinition.comments: So just ISO 639-3? Not allowing ENG-CA or something?

elementDefinition.name: Person.language.use
elementDefinition.definition: A code the describes how well the language is spoken
elementDefinition.comments: No differentiation is made between spoken and written functionality here

elementDefinition.name: Person.relatedPerson
elementDefinition.definition: Other persons who are related to this person. The relationship might be one of several types: kin (familial or marital), financial or legal (such as guardian), biological (e.g. donor, donation-recipient) or casual (i.e. friend).
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track next of kin, or other people who may need to contacted/consulting regarding the patient's healthcare status or who might otherwise influence their treatment

elementDefinition.name: Person.relatedPerson.id
elementDefinition.definition: Identifier the related person - may be a full link to a Person resource, or some other kind of identifier
elementDefinition.requirements: may have an identifier for the person that can be used to source contact details

elementDefinition.name: Person.relatedPerson.role
elementDefinition.definition: Code that specifies how this person is related to the subject. A code is required.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know how the person is related

elementDefinition.name: Person.relatedPerson.name
elementDefinition.definition: A name should be specified for the related person

elementDefinition.name: Person.relatedPerson.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contact details (phone, email etc) should be provided for the person

elementDefinition.name: Person.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: Person.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of person, for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: LabReport
elementDefinition.definition: The findings and interpretation of pathology tests performed on tissues and body fluids. This is typically done in a laboratory but may be done in other environments such as at the point of care
elementDefinition.requirements: Use to record any pathology test result, including the result of a test on a specimen taken as part of a composite procedure or operation.
elementDefinition.comments: Not to be used for reporting on non-pathology test results e.g. diagnostic imaging, ECG or respiratory function tests. Not to be used to represent an entire cumulative report. This Pathology test result archetype represents only one of the result sets that is usually viewed as a vertical in a cumulative test report. A cumulative report is a view that is constructed from the results represented by multiple OBSERVATION archetypes. This archetype is suitable for representation of general pathology test results, but not intended to cover full synoptic reports. For these, additional resources are required to represent the data properly
elementDefinition.rim: Observation[isNormalAct() and subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and domainMember("LabObservationType", code)]

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.id
elementDefinition.definition: Master Resource Id, always first in all resources
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./id[isNormalDatatype() and displayable="false" and scope="OBJ" and reliability="ISS"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.status
elementDefinition.definition: The status of the pathology test result as a whole
elementDefinition.requirements: Labs routinely issue provisional/incomplete reports, or withdraw previously released reports

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.issued
elementDefinition.definition: The date and/or time that the result was issued from the source for the recorded ‘Test result status
elementDefinition.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the report was released
elementDefinition.comments: May be different from LabReport.updated, because that is the status of this record, not the report the record is about
elementDefinition.rim: firstOf(unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="VRF" and isNormalParticipation()]/time[type="TS"]), unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/time[type="TS"]))

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.patient
elementDefinition.definition: The patient about who the report is about
elementDefinition.requirements: Must know the patient context
elementDefinition.todo: need to check the wording -is it about, upon, for?

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.admission
elementDefinition.definition: The admission that this diagnostic investigation is associated with
elementDefinition.requirements: Some institutions track and file diagnostic reports under a specific admission
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./inboundRelationship[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#ENC", code) and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.laboratory
elementDefinition.definition: The laboratory service that issued the report
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know how to contact if there are queries about the results. Also may need to track the source of reports for secondary data analysis
elementDefinition.comments: This is not necessarily the source of the atomic reports - it's the lab that takes responsibility for the clinical report
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]/scoper[subsumesCode("EntityClass#ORG", classCode) and determinerCode="INSTANCE"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.reportId
elementDefinition.definition: The local ID assigned to the report by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know what identifier to use when making queries about this report from the source laboratory

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail
elementDefinition.definition: Details concerning a single pathology test requested.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued, and also to report what diagnostic test swere requested (not always the same as what is delivered)
elementDefinition.comments: Note: Usually there is one test request for each result, however in some circumstances multiple test requests may be represented using a single Pathology test result resource
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="FLFS" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and subsumes("ActMood#PRMS", moodCode) and isNormalAct()])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail.requestOrderId
elementDefinition.definition: The local ID assigned to the order by the order requester.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued
elementDefinition.comments: Equivalent to the Placer Order Identifier
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="FLFS" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and subsumes("ActMood#RQO", moodCode) and isNormalAct()]/id[scope="OBJ" and displayable="true"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail.receiverOrderId
elementDefinition.definition: The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to track completion of requests based on reports issued
elementDefinition.comments: Usually equivalent to the DICOM Accession Number and the Filler Order Identifier.

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail.requestTest
elementDefinition.definition: Identification of pathology test requested,
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to report what diagnostic test swere requested (not always the same as what is delivered)
elementDefinition.comments: Useful where the test requested differs from the test actually performed.

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail.requester
elementDefinition.definition: Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test.
elementDefinition.requirements: The requesting clinician may need to be contacted concerning the interpretation of the lab report
elementDefinition.rim:
Agent: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]
Organization: unique(./participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation()]/role[subsumesCode("RoleClass#ASSIGN", classCode)]/scoper[subsumesCode("EntityClass#ORG", classCode) and determinerCode="INSTANCE" and code[isNormalDatatype]])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.requestDetail.clinicalInfo
elementDefinition.definition: Details of the clinical information provided to the laboratory along with the original request
elementDefinition.requirements: Knowing the clinical information may influence the interpretation of the result
elementDefinition.todo: This isn't really *ANY* resource. You can't send a drug or an Animal or a bunch of other things. What you really want here are "acts", and I suspect there's a constraint that the subject of the LabReport must have participated in them as subject or perhaps in some other way.

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.reportName
elementDefinition.definition: Identification of the pathology test performed, sometimes including specimen type.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know what report this is, so clinicians can filter/find the reports they are looking for
elementDefinition.comments: A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests.

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.service
elementDefinition.definition: The diagnostic service that performs the examination e.g. biochemistry, haematology.
elementDefinition.requirements: Help clinicians filter/find the reports they are looking for
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#LIST", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and inDomain(code,"Lab Service") and isNormalAct()]/code
elementDefinition.todo: I'm not sure this is in the 80%.

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.diagnosticTime
elementDefinition.definition: The diagnostically relevant time for this report
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know where in the patient history to file/present this report
elementDefinition.comments: The diagnostically relevant time can be derived from the specimen collection times, but the specimen information is not always available, and the exact relationship is not always automatic

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.specimen
elementDefinition.definition: Details about the specimen if all individual test results are derived from the same specimen
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based
elementDefinition.comments: If the specimen is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test result name, then this additional data may be redundant. If there are multiple specimens, these may be represented per 'Result group'

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup
elementDefinition.definition: A group of results. Results may be grouped by specimen, or by some value in LabReport.resultGroup.name to describe what binds all the results together.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to report groups of results, where the result grouping is arbitrary, but meaningful
elementDefinition.comments: Many (most) lab reports don't really have a meaningful group. In these cases, just create a single group with no specimen or name
elementDefinition.rim: ./outboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[isNormalAct() and subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and fromDomain(code, "LabObservationBattery")]

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.name
elementDefinition.definition: A code or name that describes the group of results
elementDefinition.comments: For example, the antibody code for a goup of antibody related test, or the organism code for a group of isolate/sensitivities. Leave blank if there is no particular meaning associated with the group

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.specimen
elementDefinition.definition: Details about the individual specimen to which these ‘Result group’ test results refer, where testing of multiple specimens is required.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to report information about the collected specimens on which the report is based

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result
elementDefinition.definition: Specific detailed result, including both the value of the result item, and additional information that may be useful for clinical interpretation. Results include whatever specific data items pathology labs report as part of the clinical service; it is not confined to measurements.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to report results with information that assist with interpretation
elementDefinition.rim: ./outboundRelationship[typeCode="COMP" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct() and fromDomain(code, "LabObservationResult")]

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.name
elementDefinition.definition: Identifies the meaning of the value
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to know what the result is about
elementDefinition.comments: results are fundamentally a name - value pair with additional clarifying information

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.value[x]
elementDefinition.definition: Actual value of the result. Most result values will be numerical measurements, but others may be coded concepts, free text, or multimedia images
elementDefinition.requirements: Need a value for the result

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.flag
elementDefinition.definition: Flag indicating the abnormal status of the result
elementDefinition.todo: The proposed set of codes are too narrow (and doesn't map well to v3.)

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.status
elementDefinition.definition: The status of the result value
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to track the status of individual results - some results are finalised before the whole report is finalised

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.comments
elementDefinition.definition: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable. values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to provide free text additional information
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and mapsTo(code, "LOINC# 48767-8") and isNormalAct()]/value[type="ST"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.referenceRange
elementDefinition.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to provide multiple reference ranges
elementDefinition.comments: Most results only have one reference range. Some non-numerical results don't have a reference range
elementDefinition.rim: ./outboundRelationship[typeCode="REFV" and isNormalActRelationship()]/target[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and isCriterionInd="true" and isNormalAct()]
elementDefinition.todo: Are multiple reference ranges in the 80%?

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.referenceRange.meaning
elementDefinition.definition: Code for the meaning of the reference range
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to say what kind of reference range this is - normal, recommended, therapeutic, or perhaps what state this reference range applies to (i.e. hormonal cycles)

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.resultGroup.result.referenceRange.range[x]
elementDefinition.definition: Actual value of the reference range. May be a quantity (<20mg/L), an interval (10-20 umol/L), or some text
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to report numerical or text reference ranges, and handle legacy data
elementDefinition.comments: Text reference ranges are typically used in endocrinology, or for legacy data with string reference ranges

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.conclusion
elementDefinition.definition: Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the pathology test results.
elementDefinition.requirements: Need to be able to provide a conclusion that is not lost amongst the basic result data
elementDefinition.comments: common reports don't have a conclusion, but some do
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SPRT" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and mapsTo(code, "LOINC# 48767-8") and isNormalAct()]/value[type="ST"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.codedDiagnosis
elementDefinition.definition: Codes for the conclusion
elementDefinition.rim: unique(./inboundRelationship[typeCode="SPRT" and isNormalActRelationship()]/source[subsumesCode("ActClass#OBS", classCode) and moodCode="EVN" and subsumesCode(code, "LOINC# 54531-9") and isNormalAct()]/value[type="CD"])

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.representation
elementDefinition.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they must be semantically equivalent.
elementDefinition.requirements: Laboratory needs to be able to provide it's own fully formatted report for clinical fidelity
elementDefinition.comments: Possible formats: text/html, text/plain, text/rtf, application/msword, application/pdf, application/rtf, application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: LabReport.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of report, for human interpretation

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance
elementDefinition.definition: A conformance statement about how one or more FHIR documents

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.id
elementDefinition.definition: Globally unique Conformance Statement Id (Must be a UUID)

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.date
elementDefinition.definition: Date that this conformance statement is published

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.publisher
elementDefinition.definition: The organization that publishes this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.publisher.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name of Organization

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.publisher.address
elementDefinition.definition: Address of Organization

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.publisher.contact
elementDefinition.definition: Contacts for Organization

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.software
elementDefinition.definition: The software that is covered by this conformance statement

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.software.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name software is known by

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.software.version
elementDefinition.definition: Version covered by this statement

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.software.releaseDate
elementDefinition.definition: Date this version released

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.profile
elementDefinition.definition: Additional other profiles that apply to this conformance statement.
elementDefinition.comments: Generally these profiles make constraints on the bindings of concept domains / value sets

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.document
elementDefinition.definition: A document definition

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.document.name
elementDefinition.definition: Name for this particular document profile

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.document.purpose
elementDefinition.definition: Human description of this particular profile

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.document.resource
elementDefinition.definition: Constraint on a resource used in the document
elementDefinition.comments: The first resource is the document resource

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.extensions
elementDefinition.definition: See Extensions

elementDefinition.name: DocumentConformance.text
elementDefinition.definition: Text summary of conformance profile for human interpretation

conceptDomain.name: MessageConformanceEventMode
conceptDomain.definition: The mode of a message conformance statement

item.definition: The application sends requests and receives responses
The application receives requests and sends responses

conceptDomain.name: ResourceProfileStatus
conceptDomain.definition: The lifecycle status of a Resource Profile

item.definition: This profile is still under development
this profile was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/evangelisation)
This profile is ready for use in production systems
This profile has been withdrawn
This profile was superceded by a more recent version

conceptDomain.name: DataType
conceptDomain.definition: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types

conceptDomain.name: MediaType
conceptDomain.definition: The mime type of an attachment

conceptDomain.name: NarrativeStatus
conceptDomain.definition: The status of a resource narrative

item.definition: The contents of the narrative are entirely generated from the structured data in the resource.
The contents of the narrative are entirely generated from the structured data in the resource, and some of the structured data is contained in extensions
The contents of the narrative contain additional information not found in the structured data

conceptDomain.name: AgentRole
conceptDomain.definition: The role a person plays representing an organization

conceptDomain.name: PersonRelationship
conceptDomain.definition: The relationship a person has to the subject, including familial, marital, financial, legal, and casual relationships

conceptDomain.name: AnimalSpecies
conceptDomain.definition: The species of an animal

conceptDomain.name: IdentifierType
conceptDomain.definition: The type of human identifier

item.definition: Account number
item.comments: An identifier that is unique to an account.

item.definition: Credit Card Number
item.comments: A credit card number (or debit card).

item.definition: Microchip Number
item.comments: implanted, for animals, or a worn RFID for humans

item.definition: A Registry Number
Insurance Scheme Member Number
item.comments: Identifies the person as a member of an insurance scheme.

item.definition: National Healthcare Identifier
item.comments: May not only be used for healthcare.

item.definition: National Social Security Number
State Healthcare Identifier
item.comments: May not only be used for healthcare.

item.definition: Patient identifier
item.comments: Frequently called MRN (medical record number) or UR (unit record number).

item.definition: Facility ID
Provider number
item.comments: a number allocated to a person as a provider of healthcare resources.

conceptDomain.name: AnimalRelationship
conceptDomain.definition: The relationship of an animal to another entity (person, corporation, or other animal)

conceptDomain.name: LabReportNames
conceptDomain.definition: codes for report names

conceptDomain.name: PrescriptionStatus
conceptDomain.definition: The status of a prescription

item.definition: Patient is using the prescribed medicin
Prescription is no longer current

conceptDomain.name: PatientConfidentiality
conceptDomain.definition: The confidentiality of the records associated with this patient

conceptDomain.name: AddressUse
conceptDomain.definition: The use of an address

item.definition: A communication address at a home.
An office address. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.
A temporary address. The period can provide more detailed information.
This address is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records)

conceptDomain.name: NamePartType
conceptDomain.definition: Type of a part of a human name

item.definition: Family name, this is the name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.
Given name. NOTE Not to be called first name since given names do not always come first. .
Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status etc. NOTE Title name parts include name parts that come after the name, such as qualifications.

conceptDomain.name: ContactUse
conceptDomain.definition: How to use this address

item.definition: A communication contact at a home; attempted contacts for business purposes might intrude privacy and chances are one will contact family or other household members instead of the person one wishes to call. Typically used with urgent cases, or if no other contacts are available.
An office contact. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.
A temporary contact. The period can provide more detailed information.
This contact is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records)
A telecommunication device that moves and stays with its owner. May have characteristics of all other use codes, suitable for urgent matters, not the first choice for routine business

conceptDomain.name: NarrativeMapSource
conceptDomain.definition: Which is the source in a Narrative <-> Data mapping

item.definition: The text is the original data
The data is the original data

conceptDomain.name: BooleanYesNo
conceptDomain.definition: Either yes or no, true or false

item.definition: TRUE
FALSE

conceptDomain.name: LabRequests
conceptDomain.definition: codes for requestable tests

conceptDomain.name: AnimalGender
conceptDomain.definition: The gender of an animal

conceptDomain.name: AnimalStrain
conceptDomain.definition: The strain of an animal

conceptDomain.name: Religion
conceptDomain.definition: The denomination to which a person professes affiliation

conceptDomain.name: PrescriptionReason
conceptDomain.definition: Medical reason for prescribing a medicine

conceptDomain.name: Race
conceptDomain.definition: The race of the person

conceptDomain.name: ContactSystem
conceptDomain.definition: What kind of contact this is

item.definition: the value is a telephone number used for voice calls. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.
the value is a fax machine. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.
the value is an email address
The value is a url. This is intended for various personal contacts including blogs, twitter, facebook etc. Do not use for email addresses

conceptDomain.name: Accreditation
conceptDomain.definition: Accreditations an organization may be granted

conceptDomain.name: DocumentSectionType
conceptDomain.definition: Type of a clinical document section

conceptDomain.name: LabDiagnosisCodes
conceptDomain.definition: Codes for laboratory diagnoses

conceptDomain.name: LabReportStatus
conceptDomain.definition: The status of a report or result item

item.definition: The existence of the result is registered, but there is no result yet available
This is an initial or interim result: data may be missing or verification not been performed
The result is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist
The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist
The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called aborted)
The result has been withdrawn following previous Final release

conceptDomain.name: AdministrationPrecondition
conceptDomain.definition: Precondition for administering medication

conceptDomain.name: ConformanceType
