conceptDomain.definition: The conformance value for an element

item.definition: The element is or must always be present without a dataAbsentReason
The element may need to be present (with no dataAbsentReasons) depending on the condition
The element may or may not be present
The element can not present or will be rejected if received

conceptDomain.name: AdministrationInstruction
conceptDomain.definition: Instructions for administering medication

conceptDomain.name: DataAbsentReason
conceptDomain.definition: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing

item.definition: The value is not known
The source human does not know the value
There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known
The workflow didn't lead to this value being known
The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons
item.comments: Using masked may be breach of security or confidentiality, but there are times when it's use is required to support alternate workflows for gaining access to denied information.

item.definition: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element
The content of the data is represented as text
Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available

conceptDomain.name: LabResultNames
conceptDomain.definition: codes for results

conceptDomain.name: PaperRecordLocation
conceptDomain.definition: A physical location for a record. (Usually site specific)

conceptDomain.name: DocumentAuthenticationMode
conceptDomain.definition: The way in which a person authenticated a document

item.definition: The person authenticated the document in their personal capacity
The person authenticated the document in their professional capacity
The person authenticated the document and accepted legal responsibility for it's content
The organization authenticated the document as consistent with their policies and procedures

conceptDomain.name: Industry
conceptDomain.definition: Code for the type of industry

conceptDomain.name: ConceptBindingType
conceptDomain.definition: The type of a binding for a concept domain

item.definition: The concept domain is not bound to anything
The concept domain is bound to a list of supplied codes - only those codes are allowed
The concept domain references some external definition by a provided reference
The concept domain references a set of preferred terms
This profile was superceded by a more recent version
The concept domain is defined by an external authority identified in the reference

conceptDomain.name: PatientDiet
conceptDomain.definition: casual dietary restrictions associated with this patient

conceptDomain.name: MedicationKind
conceptDomain.definition: The kind of medication, vaccine or therapeutic material

conceptDomain.name: AddressPartType
conceptDomain.definition: Type of address part

item.definition: Part of an address line (typically used with an extension that further defines the meaning of the part).
A line of an address (typically used for street names & numbers, unit details, delivery hints etc) .
The name of the city, town, village, or other community or delivery centre.
sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes).
Country. ISO 3166 3 letter codes can be used in place of a full country name.
A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.
A value that uniquely identifies the postal address. (often used in barcodes).

conceptDomain.name: LabResultGroupNames
conceptDomain.definition: codes for result groups

conceptDomain.name: LanguageUse
conceptDomain.definition: How well a person speaks a language

item.definition: The person does not speak the language at all
The person has minimal functional capability in the language
The person can use the language, but may not be full conversant, particularly with regards to health concepts
The person is fully capable of using the language

conceptDomain.name: Qualifications
conceptDomain.definition: Formal qualifications, accreditations, and Certifications acquired by a person

conceptDomain.name: MessageEvent
conceptDomain.definition: One of the message types defined in FHIR messaging

conceptDomain.name: ResourceType
conceptDomain.definition: One of the resource types defined in FHIR messaging

conceptDomain.name: EventTiming
conceptDomain.definition: A real world event that a schedule is related to

item.definition: event occurs duration before the hour of sleep (or trying to)
event occurs duration after waking
event occurs duration before a meal (from the latin ante cibus)
event occurs duration before breakfast (from the latin ante cibus matutinus)
event occurs duration before lunch (from the latin ante cibus diurnus)
event occurs duration before dinner (from the latin ante cibus vespertinus)
event occurs duration after a meal (from the latin post cibus)
event occurs duration after breakfast (from the latin post cibus matutinus)
event occurs duration after lunch (from the latin post cibus diurnus)
event occurs duration after dinner (from the latin post cibus vespertinus)

conceptDomain.name: ResourceIdSource
conceptDomain.definition: The system responsible for the provision of a resource unique id

item.definition: The client must provide a unique resource id
The server defines the id and will reject any client attempt to define it
The client can provide a unique resource id, or the server will define it instead

conceptDomain.name: DocumentType
conceptDomain.definition: Type of a clinical document

conceptDomain.name: NameUse
conceptDomain.definition: The use of a human name

item.definition: Known as/conventional/the one you normally use
The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. May be called legal name.
A temporary name. A name valid time can provide more detailed information. This may also be used for temporary names assigned at birth or in emergency situations.
Anonymous assigned name, alias, or pseudonym (used to protect a person's identity for privacy reasons)
This name is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records)

A name used prior to marriage. Marriage naming customs vary greatly around the world. This name use is for use by applications that collect and store maiden names. Though the concept of maiden name is often gender specific, the use of this term is not gender specific. The use of this term does not imply any particular history for a person‘s name, nor should the maiden name be determined algorithmically

conceptDomain.name: ExtensionState
conceptDomain.definition: The state of an extension

item.definition: The extension contains information that qualifies or negates another element, and must be understood by an application processing the resource
The extension has been promoted into the main content of the resource, and the content is found at the reference. The extension continues to be defined for backward compatibility

conceptDomain.name: LabResultFlag
conceptDomain.definition: codes for result flags

conceptDomain.name: OrganisationType
conceptDomain.definition: The type of an organisation
conceptDomain.source: SNOMED-CT, and the HL7 v3 Entity Code table

conceptDomain.name: QuantityStatus
conceptDomain.definition: how the Quantity should be understood and represented

item.definition: The actual value is less than the given value
The actual value is less than or equal to the given value
The actual value is greater than or equal to the given value
The actual value is greater than the given value

conceptDomain.name: ResponseCode
conceptDomain.definition: The kind of response to a message

item.definition: The message was accepted and processed without error

Some internal unexpected error occured - wait and try again. Note - this is usually used for things like database unavailable, which may be expected to resolve, though human intervention may be required
The message was rejected because of some content in it. There is no point in re-sending without change. The response narrative must describe what the issue is

The message was rejected because of some event-specific business rules, and it may be possible to modify the request and re-submit (as a different request). The response data must clarify what the change would be, as described by the event definition
A middleware agent was unable to deliver the message to it's supposed destination

conceptDomain.name: AdministrationRoute
conceptDomain.definition: Route by which a medication is administered

conceptDomain.name: LabServices
conceptDomain.definition: codes for laboratory services

conceptDomain.name: RestfulConformanceMode
conceptDomain.definition: The mode of a restful conformance statement

item.definition: The application acts as a server for this resource
The application acts as a client for this resource

conceptDomain.name: AdministrativeGender
conceptDomain.definition: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes

conceptDomain.name: OrganizationRelationship
conceptDomain.definition: The relationship an organization has to the subject, including sub and super organizations, and other kind of relationships such as partner organisations

conceptDomain.name: EventReason
conceptDomain.definition: The reason for an event occurring

conceptDomain.name: Language
conceptDomain.definition: A human language

conceptDomain.name: LabReferenceRanges
conceptDomain.definition: Code for the meaning of a reference range
